newsitem.title: USA: Magnum Petroleum acquires 2 Texas oil wells.
newsitem.headline: Magnum Petroleum acquires 2 Texas oil wells.

text.p: Magnum Petroleum Inc said Wednesday it acquired two producing oil wells located in Terry and Hockley Counties, Texas, from a private independent oil company for $450,000.
The two wells have combined daily production of 56 barrels of oil and 80,000 cubc feet of natual gas, Magnum said.
The purchase price included $420,000 in cash and $30,000 in restricted Magnum common stock valued at $3.75 per share.
It said proved oil and natural gas reserves acquired are estimated at 149,211 barrels of oil and 24.5 million cubic feet of natural gas.

Additionally, the company said the Jesse Hampton Unit Well 1, located in the Chapel Hill Field in Smith County, Texas, was recompleted in the Travis Peak formation at the depths of 8,269 to 8,390 feet and is producing at the rate of 155 barrels of oil and 220,000 cubic feet of natural gas per day.
Magnum has a 33.5 percent working working interest in the Jesse Hampton Unit.
